transcripts.text: It's quite phenomenal, the hypocrisy here, though, isn't it, Lady Colin Campbell?  Because we have Harry and Meghan constantly whining about the fact that the media invades their privacy, that the media uses source quotes, and then they've gone and done exactly the same thing themselves.

Well, you know, Harry and Meghan are the sort of people who have one rule for themselves and another rule for everybody else.  They are great practitioners of double standards.  I think to actually shift it very slightly, in my book, I go into the fact that Harry has really rather serious mental issues and Meghan has serious personality problems.  And I think the conjunction of those two things accounts for an awful lot of what is happening.
So should we feel sympathy for them then, if that is the case?

Well, I think you need to be very careful.  You can feel sympathy for people who are dangerous and damaging and destructive, while at the same time protecting yourself against the worst effects of their misconduct.  And I think we... I think we should sympathize up to a degree, but we shouldn't be letting them off the hook.  They are batting 40.  They're not children.  They're not young.  They have entered early middle age.  They are supposed to be mature.  They are overprivileged brats who are begging and pleading for sympathy as if they are disadvantaged.  I mean, they're not disadvantaged and they have kicked sand in everybody's face.  I have to tell you, one of the things that has really upset me about Meghan and Harry's story is also how we, the British people, embrace them.  I mean, two years ago, we were the most popular couple in the country.  Everybody was so enthusiastic about it all.  They have kicked sand in everybody's face.  They have their American PR people briefing against the British people.
They do.
Saying that we are racist.

And it's a totally outrageous claim, Lady Colin Campbell, because I remember back to that wedding day.  And it was one of the happiest days that we have had in this country collectively for many, many years.  The entire nation stopped.  We hosted street parties.  How on earth can you say the British public was racist towards Meghan when we celebrated her wedding?  Like no royal wedding since Charles and Diana.

And embraced her, embraced her.  I mean, she was given so many.  You know, no other royal bride was ever asked to Sandringham before Christmas.  She was asked.  No other royal bride was ever put on the balcony beside the Queen for the first performance.  No other bride was ever taken on an away day trip with the Queen.  And she has systematically kicked sand in everybody's face.  I think it's very sad.  because I'm very mindful being Jamaican of the tremendous opportunity she was given and how to people of color all over the world.  And you speak about hundreds of millions, if not billions of people whose hopes were invested in her being a great success.  And look at what she's done with it.  She's taken, she's just thrown it away.  She is really, I have to tell you, she does clearly have problems.  And he does as well, because it's almost a talent.

But Lady C, though, does she actually have issues?  Or actually, is she just desperate for fame and attention?  Because I thought it was very telling, the revelation today.  And actually, it's quite an own goal, I would say today, Lady C, the revelation that Meghan, when she was in Canada... filming Suits, which wasn't that many years ago.  She used to sell stories herself to newspapers, or at least give stories to newspapers, and set up paparazzi photographs of herself.  So actually, is she not just someone that craves attention and fame?

Absolutely.  Absolutely.  But this is all a part of her deeply flawed personality.  because she does have a personality, if not disorder, it's a malfunctioning personality.  She is greedy for attention.  She is always victimized, no matter how much you give her.  I quote someone in the book saying, if you gave Meghan California, she'd want Arizona as well.  I mean, is greedy, she is needy, she is demanding, and she is ungrateful.
Or is she just ambitious?  Is she just very, very highly ambitious?  And actually, some people would say, what's wrong with that?

Well, ambition up to a point is a desirable thing.  Overweening ambition, when you're straying into the Lady Macbeth territory, that is very destructive.  And I think also, though, a part of it is that a lot of, you know, being royal has gone to Meghan's head in a big way.  And she has misread the situation and she's misread the power that she feels she was going to acquire as a royal.  Royals do not acquire power.  They acquire influence while doing public service.  But I think Meghan definitely, I spoke to psychologists about Meghan.  It's all in my book, by the way.  I examine them both very carefully as characters, personalities, how their upbringing impacted upon them.  Both Meghan and Harry were spoilt.  He by his mother, she by her father.  And Meghan definitely displays a lot of characteristics of somebody who is on the narcissistic cusp So she could be an narcissist.

And obviously, I mean, we should obviously stress that, of course, this is analysis by Lady Colin Campbell in her book.  We obviously can't say that they are suffering from any condition of any form.  But I would just ask Lady C as well.  Is the timing of this book not particularly inappropriate, given that the world is in the midst of an unprecedented pandemic?

Oh, of course.  I mean, the whole thing is wildly inappropriate.  But then, you know, savaging a nation that treated me well, savaging a family that treated me well, it's all wildly inappropriate.  But it also serves their purposes, their need for attention.  And also, you see, Meghan thought she had it all figured out very cleverly.  She would spend half the year here, Half the year in America, she'd milk the commercial and Hollywood, and she'd play political parts,  etc.,  all of which is forbidden for royalty.  And she thought she'd be able to get away with it.
And you believe she has political ambitions?
Well, that's what she's told me.  She has told people.  I have no beliefs.  I only go off what I've been told.

Well, I have to say, Lady C, I know you've got a lot of criticism for that, but let me tell you something that I've never said before.  I knew someone very, very close to Meghan who told me specifically that she had ambitions to run for office in the US.

Well, she's told other people as well, so young.  Thank you for backing me up on that.  I think it's ludicrous.  If you want to become a politician, you don't marry a member of the British Royal family.  But of course, had Meghan not married Harry, she would still be a relative non-entity.  She was a D-list ensemble player in a cable television show that never even made it to the networks.
Yeah, I mean, don't get me wrong, though.  She was a success.  She just wasn't an A-list success, was she?
That's right.  I'm not denigrating her accomplishments.  I'm simply trying to place them in their proper context.
No, she was not.  Angelina Jolie, is what you're saying.
No, and she, you know, she's never starred in anything in her life except... as a lawyer.  And she's quite determined to become a huge star.
